lines.text: I don't know Charlie, I might be crazy, but if I don't eat at least once a week I get dizzy spells.

[to Eddie, upon their second meeting]
Now that I've met you again, I feel that I have lived a full life. Think I'll go home and kill myself.
Why don't you fall for another man?
I don't want a man. I want you.

[to Connie]
Gee, if I only had your face. You know, when I was born, my father took one look at me, called up the insurance company, and said 'I want to report an accident.'
Why don't you move over so I can see the girls?
Why don't you move over sothe girls won't see you?
You must have the theater in your blood.
Yes, and my blood is in a lot of these theaters.
Why don't you fall for some other man?
I don't want a man... I want you!
Why don't you go home to momma before she comes to get you?

[Last lines. Aside to audience about Eddie as she goes out the door]
I love that boy! Well...
[She slaps her hands up and down]
